name: Urban Ecology
description: The ecology of urban areas through consideration of the biological and physical environments, in particular how the human-constructed environment alters pre-existing biophysical conditions and interactions. Encompasses a comparative perspective to study the development of these emerging ecosystems of increasing importance given global urbanization. One or two Saturday field trips (a fee of approximately $15 may be charged for field trip transportation.)
prerequisites: BIO220H1 and at least one of EEB319H1/EEB321H1/EEB365H1/ENV334H1
